definition: to watch the fires burning across the river/to delay entering the fray until all others have been exhausted by fighting amongst themselves (idiom)
to separate/to partition/to stand or lie between/at a distance from/after or at an interval of
bank/shore/beach/coast/CL:個|个[ge4]
variant of 岸[an4]
surname Guan
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
Taoist monastery/palace gate watchtower/platform
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: I would not mind any of this if the French did not keep harping on with malicious glee about how tough things are across the Atlantic.
sentences.chinese: 法国人对大西洋彼岸的窘境隔岸观火我并不介意。

definition: sit on the mountain and watch the tigers fight/watch in safety whilst others fight then reap the rewards when both sides are exhausted (idiom)
not to get involved/to stay out of it
benefit from others' dispute (idiom)
to sit and await success or failure (idiom); to wait to see the outcome of a fight before taking sides/to sit on the fence
a matter of no concern to oneself (idiom)
lit. sandpiper and clam war together (and the fisherman catches both) (idiom); fig. neighbors who can't agree lose out to a third party
lit. to pull chestnuts out of the fire (idiom)/fig. to be sb's cat's-paw
a wise man looks after his own hide (idiom)/to put one's own safety before matters of principle
to watch a play/to watch passively (i.e. from the sidelines, from the crowd)
to loot a burning house/to profit from sb's misfortune (idiom)
internal strife (family, group, etc)
to feel unconcerned and let matters rest (idiom)
